newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber closes higher in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber closes higher in thin trade.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices ended higher in quiet trade after trading narrowly for the greater part of the day on lack of keen demand.
Dealers said despite a lower Tokyo market, prices were marked up on some covering by local dealers.

Expectations of slow supplies of raw materials also kept most producers to hold back for higher prices, they said, adding supplies will get tighter if the wet season continues in the main growing areas.
Enquiries from Europe was still slow but some hand-to-mouth basis business was seen from Far East consumers.

At the close, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board set market indicator price for new trading month October RSS1 buyer at 332 cents ($1.33) a kg, up half a cent fron Tuesday while October SMR 20 buyer rose a cent at 318.50.
Traders quoted SMR10 sellers at 320 cents, SMR CV at 380 to 383, SMR L at 361 and drum latex FOB at 251-253.
The INRO five-day average was 251.40 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Sept 3 from 250.36 on Sept 2. The daily indicator was 252.77 against 252.69. -- Tan Lee Lee (603-230-7510) ($1=2.4960 ringgit)
